title: Issues with lag since the Pre-Season update
body:
Hello all!

I have seen a little bit of people having issues with lag since the update and it getting redirected to it being a network issue, yet there is a lot of different people (which probably means a few different networks) and that just seems improbable to me.  So I ran the tests that I saw a support person post on another post and figured I would post it here. Can we please solve this, I don't know if I can handle ping spikes of almost 150.

Overall Connection Score for This Game
83
/100 
Avg Latency	88.91 ms
Avg Packet Loss	6.51%
Avg Jitter	24.81 ms

replies.body:
So these two lines.....

> | No response from host - 100 | 56 | 0 | 0 | 0 | 0 | 0 |
> 
> | No response from host - 100 | 56 | 0 | 0 | 0 | 0 | 0 |

are showing some *major* packet loss. Packet loss means your connection is getting damaged before it ever reaches our server, which means it's not something we can fix on our end. Typically this is caused by a damaged or improperly working ISP node, but overall it'd be best to reach out to your ISP with this data to show them proof that something may not be working correctly. In the meantime, you could try using a VPN to get a better route to our server, but that should only be a temp fix.

I will try the VPN throughout the holiday, but my ISP is a little special, for being a major company.  I will get ahold of them and see what they say.
Thank you!
Just as an update to those who read this, I paid the $10 bucks for a VPN and it only made my ping worse.

i'm having them terribly too, i just sent a ticket in to riot and hopefully that'll help. i have a new high end laptop and i've tested this on several different wifi connections. my ping used to be a consistent 36 until the last month or so, i get spikes up to 200+, my friends get it as well.
